cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north and northeast, paralleling the coast into southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / central Texas coast (just east of the Calhoun Port Authority)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (tropical-storm watch section)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA for TS winds; Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA for storm surge
weather_observation.impacted_coast: middle Texas coast through southern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely beginning Monday morning, with a 65% chance of occurrence in the first 12 hours and a 27% chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft possible in Matagorda and San Antonio bays, including the Calhoun Port vicinity; water levels could locally exceed 3 ft at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rainfall with isolated 15 inch totals forecast along the middle Texas coast, producing flash and urban flooding around Calhoun Port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches.
